jobs.title: Senior Simulation Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission:

At Sunrise Robotics, we are dedicated to augmenting humanity through intelligent robotics. Our mission is to elevate the world of manufacturing by introducing intelligent, flexible robots that enhance human capabilities and existing machinery, ushering in the next era of production at higher quality, with less waste, and lower cost.

Our Vision:

We see a future where every element of manufacturing, from design to assembly, is optimised with intelligent automation. Our vision is to integrate flexible robotic solutions, based on generic hardware and advanced software/AI capabilities, into manufacturing, particularly in small and medium-sized enterprises, to make automation economically viable and accessible, for all sizes of manufacturers. We are not just building robots; we are creating the strategically crucial components for autonomous, intelligent agents of the future.

The Role:

We are seeking a Senior Simulation Engineer with a strong background in game development or simulation and a passion for robotics and intelligent systems in manufacturing. In this role, you will lead the design and development of high-fidelity simulation environments that replicate complex industrial systems. Your work will be critical in validating robotic control algorithms, testing edge-case scenarios, and accelerating development across robotics, AI, and systems engineering teams.

You’ll be responsible for creating realistic, physics-based assets, building dynamic and interactive simulation scenes, and implementing supporting tools and workflows. You will also play a key role in shaping our digital twin strategy, helping to bridge the gap between virtual and real-world manufacturing systems.

What You Will Do:

  • Create and manage realistic simulation scenes in Isaac Sim

  • Design and implement physics assets that accurately represent robotic components

  • Develop diverse simulation scenarios for control algorithm testing

  • Implement logic and behaviors to control scene dynamics

  • Build supporting tools to streamline simulation development workflows

  • Contribute to the development of digital twins and simulation-based validation systems

  • Collaborate with AI, robotics, and other engineering teams to support cross-functional needs

Who You Are:

  • An experienced engineer with a strong background in simulation or game development

  • Experienced in working with engines such as Unity3D, Unreal Engine, Godot, or NVIDIA Omniverse for 5+ years

  • Solid grasp of 3D mathematics, particularly linear algebra and kinematics

  • Skilled in core simulation concepts like collision detection, rigid body dynamics, and particle systems

  • A clean and pragmatic coder who writes maintainable, well-documented software

  • A team player who thrives in collaborative, interdisciplinary environments

  • An effective communicator, able to translate technical details into clear and engaging narratives

  • Deeply passionate about robotics, automation, and the role of intelligent systems in modern industry

  • Naturally curious, self-motivated, and constantly exploring new tools and approaches

  • A proactive problem-solver who takes initiative and ownership from idea to execution

  • A quick learner who can ramp up fast on new tools, workflows, and concepts

  • Proficiency in Python

  • Working knowledge of Linux

Good to have:

  • A portfolio (videos, screenshots, or demos) showcasing past simulation or game development projects

  • Familiarity with Isaac Sim or the NVIDIA Omniverse ecosystem

  • Understanding of Behavior Trees or similar systems for scene logic and orchestration

  • Experience with industry-standard physics engines like NVIDIA PhysX, Bullet Physics, or Havok

  • Ability to implement custom physics solutions, including constraints, joints, and soft-body dynamics

Why Sunrise Robotics?

  • Play a pivotal role in defining the future of intelligent robotics and manufacturing.

  • Be part of a company that is at the forefront of technological innovation, with a clear mission and vision.

  • Competitive compensation, including equity, and a flexible work environment that values innovation, learning, and excellence.

jobs.title: Senior AI Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission:

At Sunrise Robotics, we are dedicated to augmenting humanity through intelligent robotics. Our mission is to elevate the world of manufacturing by introducing intelligent, flexible robots that enhance human capabilities and existing machinery, ushering in the next era of production at higher quality, with less waste, and lower cost.

Our Vision:

We see a future where every element of manufacturing, from design to assembly, is optimised with intelligent automation. Our vision is to integrate flexible robotic solutions, based on generic hardware and advanced software/AI capabilities, into manufacturing, particularly in small and medium-sized enterprises, to make automation economically viable and accessible, for all sizes of manufacturers. We are not just building robots; we are creating the strategically crucial components for autonomous, intelligent agents of the future.

What will you do at Sunrise Robotics:

You will have the opportunity to design and implement company wide data-oriented processes that will transport, organize and visualize our vast amount of multi-modal data. You will be responsible for the implementation and maintenance of our tailored data platform, which will collect, analyze and retrieve data for our engineering and operations teams.

Who you are:

Fundamental skills:

  • You are highly experienced in Python, with deep knowledge in data structures and algorithms.

  • You have experience with asynchronous programming and memory-efficient data handling for large data format (eg. video data and point clouds).

Cloud infrastructure & data:

  • You are highly experienced in building and managing data infrastructure on AWS - data storage - S3, data lakes architecture and serverless processing (Lambda instances) are a must.

  • You are highly experienced with data versioning and data lineage frameworks, such as DVC, Pachyderm or LakeFS or similar. You have used them in production.

  • You have experience with IaC tools, such as Terraform, Pulumi or CloudFormation.

  • You have experience with databases, such as SQLite, MongoDB, Cassandra.

  • You have experience with large multi-modal datasets (video and images, audio, ..).

MLOps and Data Pipelines:

  • You have experience with data platforms, such as Apache Spark, Dagster, Airflow or Prefect.

  • You are familiar with MLOps platforms, such as MLFlow, ClearML, ZenML, etc.

  • You are familiar with CI/CD for data workflows.

Stand out with the following:

  • Experience with multi-modal data in Robotics.

  • Experience with streaming data and pre-selecting data on edge devices (eg. Jetson, Coral, NXP).

  • Experience with synthetic data generation in Unity, Isaac Sim, or similar.

  • Experience with data and data monitoring visualization tools - Plotly, Grafana, Rerun.

  • Experience with ROS/ROS2 or other robotics frameworks.

  • Proficiency with telemetry data, such as robot logs.

Who you are not:

  • Focused on business analytics / BI tools.

  • Experienced exclusively in tabular or text data (such as marketing / sales data).

  • You have not had production experience with visual data (videos / images etc.).

  • Focused on C#, Java, Scala without significant Python experience.

  • No-code or low-code enthusiast working purely with GUI-based tools and configs.

Why Sunrise Robotics?

  • Play a pivotal role in defining the future of intelligent robotics and manufacturing.

  • Be part of a company that is at the forefront of technological innovation, with a clear mission and vision.

  • Competitive compensation, including equity, and a flexible work environment that values innovation, learning, and excellence.

jobs.title: Applied AI Research Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission:

At Sunrise Robotics, we are dedicated to augmenting humanity through intelligent robotics. Our mission is to elevate the world of manufacturing by introducing intelligent, flexible robots that enhance human capabilities and existing machinery, ushering in the next era of production at higher quality, with less waste, and lower cost.

Our Vision:

We see a future where every element of manufacturing, from design to assembly, is optimised with intelligent automation. Our vision is to integrate flexible robotic solutions, based on generic hardware and advanced software/AI capabilities, into manufacturing, particularly in small and medium-sized enterprises, to make automation economically viable and accessible, for all sizes of manufacturers. We are not just building robots; we are creating the strategically crucial components for autonomous, intelligent agents of the future.

The Role:

As an Applied AI Research Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in exploring and implementing innovative AI solutions for our advanced robotics platform and more broadly in embodied AI.

This position offers the opportunity to tackle interesting challenges and transform the latest research into impactful, real-world solutions.

What you will do:

  • Perform research and development in the following areas:

    • Foundational models, VLAs, VLMs, LLMs: Work with the latest advances in embodied AI to accomplish tasks naturally and accurately with our robots.

    • Reinforcement Learning: Explore and implement effective and applicable control strategies for robotic manipulation.

    • Sim2Real: Bridge the simulation-to-reality gap for robust model deployment by leveraging synthetic data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to collaboratively transform research insights and latest developments into practical, deployable solutions.

Who you are:

  • You have proven knowledge and demonstrable experience in machine learning, deep learning, computer vision and algorithmic development.

  • You have experience in applying research to solve complex problems and translate findings into practical implementations.

  • You have a strong understanding of LLMs, VLMs and similar advancements.

  • You have a strong understanding of reinforcement learning (on-off policy, actor-critic and model based).

  • You are proficient in Python and have experience with frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow or equivalent.

  • You have experience with (multi-modal) foundational models.

  • You can demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail and creativity.

  • You are a great communicator who can articulate and visually present thoughts and concepts in conversations and reports.

  • You are a decision maker with Occam’s razor being your modus operandi.

  • You consider yourself as an efficient planner who can determine the most reasonable steps to follow with ease.

Must have experience:

  • Python

  • AI frameworks and platforms such as PyTorch, TensorFlow and Huggingface.

  • Experience with Conda, Docker, Linux, Git and Jira - or a similar tool.

  • Experience with AWS / GCE / Azure for AI workflows.

Good to have experience:

  • VLAs and VLMs.

  • A solid understanding and experience in robotics is a plus but not mandatory - ROS/ROS2, Behavior Trees

  • Agentic AI

Why Sunrise Robotics?

  • Play a pivotal role in defining the future of intelligent robotics and manufacturing.

  • Be part of a company that is at the forefront of technological innovation, with a clear mission and vision.

  • Competitive compensation, including equity, and a flexible work environment that values innovation, learning, and excellence.

jobs.title: Computer Vision Engineer - MLOps
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission:

At Sunrise Robotics, we are dedicated to augmenting humanity through intelligent robotics. Our mission is to elevate the world of manufacturing by introducing intelligent, flexible robots that enhance human capabilities and existing machinery, ushering in the next era of production at higher quality, with less waste, and lower cost.

Our Vision:

We see a future where every element of manufacturing, from design to assembly, is optimised with intelligent automation. Our vision is to integrate flexible robotic solutions, based on generic hardware and advanced software/AI capabilities, into manufacturing, particularly in small and medium-sized enterprises, to make automation economically viable and accessible, for all sizes of manufacturers. We are not just building robots; we are creating the strategically crucial components for autonomous, intelligent agents of the future.

The Role:

As a Computer Vision Engineer you are presented with a unique and exhilarating challenge: You will be building flexible, scalable and maintainable deep learning pipelines. You will be working on 2D image-classification, object-detection, semantic & instance segmentation, metric learning, smart filtering and many more while researching the latest applicable SOTA methods.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop 2D/3D imaging based solutions to recognize objects, anomalies or certain events.

  • Contribute to the design and development of in-house MLOps.

  • Implement end-to-end CV / ML applications and deploy them to production which will be running 24/7.

  • Apply SOTA methods to create the next generation of robotics with an international multidisciplinary team.

Who You Are:

  • A very skilled and experienced computer vision or machine learning engineer who has a professional background in 2D/3D Computer Vision and 2D/3D Deep Learning.

  • A professional software engineer who has implemented solutions for production grade systems for 3+ years.

  • You have extensive experience with Python and are familiar with other programming languages, such as C++.

  • You have experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow, computer vision frameworks such as OpenCV, Numpy, Pandas and others.

  • You have in-depth knowledge of model optimization, model conversion, model deployment and are familiar with edge device compute.

  • You have experience with MLOps, experiment tracking, data versioning and model serving on platforms such as MLFlow, W&B, CometML, ClearML, etc.

  • You have experience with imaging hardware, such as industrial cameras, 3D cameras and stereo systems.

  • You have a product oriented mentality.

  • You have the ability to break down complex problems into small sub problems and build efficient hierarchical solutions.

  • You have the capacity to work with multidisciplinary and international teams and are an excellent communicator who can articulate complex architecture and solution design concepts in a clear, compelling manner.

  • You are passionate about robotics, automation, and the transformative potential of intelligent systems.

Good to Have:

  • You have experience with synthetic data generation, domain transfer and an ability to design smart and optimized data collection strategies.

  • Experience with ROS, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS / GCE.

  • Experience with NVIDIA edge devices, deployment and robotics stack.

  • Experience with Multi Domain models and contrastive learning.

Why Sunrise Robotics?

  • Play a pivotal role in defining the future of intelligent robotics and manufacturing.

  • Be part of a company that is at the forefront of technological innovation, with a clear mission and vision.

  • Competitive compensation, including equity, and a flexible work environment that values innovation, learning, and excellence.

jobs.title: Robotics Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission:

At Sunrise Robotics, we are dedicated to augmenting humanity through intelligent robotics. Our mission is to elevate the world of manufacturing by introducing intelligent, flexible robots that enhance human capabilities and existing machinery, ushering in the next era of production at higher quality, with less waste, and lower cost.

Our Vision:

We see a future where every element of manufacturing, from design to assembly, is optimised with intelligent automation. Our vision is to integrate flexible robotic solutions, based on generic hardware and advanced software/AI capabilities, into manufacturing, particularly in small and medium-sized enterprises, to make automation economically viable and accessible, for all sizes of manufacturers. We are not just building robots; we are creating the strategically crucial components for autonomous, intelligent agents of the future.

The Role:

As our (Senior) Robotics Engineer, you are presented with a unique and exhilarating challenge: to develop a) high-performance industrial robot arm control and b) vision-based manipulation algorithms. Your skill-set will also be crucial in further improving our robot simulation system by collaborating with both the AI and the Simulation teams. With your experience and knowledge will also pro-actively find areas of our system (software and hardware) that could be enhanced.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop robot control and planning interfaces in ROS 2, Python and C++.

  • Develop and integrate algorithms for collision-free path planning and inverse kinematics.

  • Develop and implement camera-based robot manipulation systems.

  • Design and develop our simulation-to-reality pipeline using Isaac Sim and ROS 2.

  • Write drivers, behavior trees and scripts for specific robot applications.

  • Build generic, reusable behavior trees for common robot tasks.

  • Implement simulation scenarios for evaluating new robot control and perception models.

Who You Are:

  • A skilled and experienced roboticist with a proven track record in robot control, simulation, vision, manipulation and path planning.

  • Very well versed in robot direct and inverse kinematics.

  • Comfortable working with both Python and C++ for developing ROS 2 software.

  • Excellent software engineer whose code can explain itself.

  • Capacity to work with multidisciplinary teams including AI, mechanical, electrical and other engineers to develop complex robotic systems and evaluate them in advanced simulation environments.

  • An excellent communicator who can articulate complex design concepts in a clear and compelling manner.

  • Passionate about robotics, automation, and the transformative potential of intelligent systems in manufacturing.

  • Insatiably curious and open minded.

Good to Have:

  • Experience in both classic machine vision as well as vision based on deep learning models.

  • Experience in calibration theory and vision based robot calibration.

  • Familiarity with domain-specific libraries (e.g. OpenCV, MoveIt, BehaviorTree.CPP, ros2_control, etc.).

  • Experience in Nvidia Omniverse and/or Isaac Sim.

  • Experience in working with robots in the manufacturing industry.

Why Sunrise Robotics?

  • Play a pivotal role in defining the future of intelligent robotics and manufacturing.

  • Be part of a company that is at the forefront of technological innovation, with a clear mission and vision.

  • An opportunity to build and lead a design culture that will set a new standard in the industry.

  • Competitive compensation, including equity, and a work environment that values innovation, learning, and excellence.

jobs.title: Forward Deployed Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission:

At Sunrise Robotics, we are dedicated to augmenting humanity through intelligent robotics. Our mission is to elevate the world of manufacturing by introducing intelligent, flexible robots that enhance human capabilities and existing machinery, ushering in the next era of production at higher quality, with less waste, and lower cost.

Our Vision:

We see a future where every element of manufacturing, from design to assembly, is optimised with intelligent automation. Our vision is to integrate flexible robotic solutions, based on generic hardware and advanced software/AI capabilities, into manufacturing, particularly in small and medium-sized enterprises, to make automation economically viable and accessible, for all sizes of manufacturers. We are not just building robots; we are creating the strategically crucial components for autonomous, intelligent agents of the future.

The Role:

As our (Senior) Delivery Engineer, you are presented with a unique and exhilarating challenge: how do we make delivery of automation solutions scalable and efficient, with minimal non-recurring engineering costs. The role requires a mindset shift from traditional system integrator one-off design, build, and delivery processes to a productised solution that facilitates scalable delivery through the use of Sunrise tools, products and processes. You are going to play a crucial part in improving and fine tuning these. Your practical experience of delivering traditional automation solutions will enable you to focus on all key areas that have the biggest improvement potential when applying Sunrise built technology. At the same time you will provide valuable customer feedback when delivering Sunrise products and fine-tune the target capabilities list in order to maximise market traction and delivery scalability.

What You'll Do:

  • Validate all the delivery processes, products and used tools and provide feedback to the R&D team about most impactful improvement areas,

  • validate product capabilities from a scalable delivery perspective,

  • frequently travel to customer sites for new robot deliveries,

  • optimise delivery and operational support processes for stability and scalability,

  • you will oversee the quality assurance process of all the Perception and Behaviour Tree outputs so that robot robustness and stability will be assured under realistic operating conditions,

  • you will perform incident investigation and response to any anomalies of the robot systems in operation.

Who You Are:

  • You are excited about completely reinventing the delivery process and scalability of flexible automation solutions.

  • You understand the fundamentals of deep learning models and how they can be efficiently re-trained for particular tasks.

  • You have experience in ROS 2 and Behaviour Tree programming.

  • You understand the high level concepts of synthetic data generation, Nvidia Isaac Sim and Omniverse environment, Quality Assurance tests.

  • Are an abstract thinker with the capability of seeing problems from different perspectives e.g. different users, high level descriptions, generalisation across different applications.

  • Capacity to work with multidisciplinary teams including AI, mechanical, electrical and other engineers to develop complex robotic systems and evaluate them in advanced simulation environments.

  • An excellent communicator who can articulate complex concepts in a clear and compelling manner.

  • Passionate about robotics, automation, and the transformative potential of intelligent systems in manufacturing.

  • Insatiably curious and open minded.

Good to Have:

  • Experience in collaborative applications.

  • Experience with ABB SafeMove.

  • Experience with Schmersal programming.

  • Experience with radar based safety (Inxpect).

  • Experience with safety analysis tools.

Why Sunrise Robotics?

  • Play a pivotal role in defining the future of intelligent robotics and manufacturing.

  • Be part of a company that is at the forefront of technological innovation, with a clear mission and vision.

  • An opportunity to build and lead a design culture that will set a new standard in the industry.

  • Competitive compensation, including equity, and a work environment that values innovation, learning, and excellence.

jobs.title: Physics Level Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our Mission:

At Sunrise Robotics, we are dedicated to augmenting humanity through intelligent robotics. Our mission is to elevate the world of manufacturing by introducing intelligent, flexible robots that enhance human capabilities and existing machinery, ushering in the next era of production at higher quality, with less waste, and lower cost.

Our Vision:

We see a future where every element of manufacturing, from design to assembly, is optimised with intelligent automation. Our vision is to integrate flexible robotic solutions, based on generic hardware and advanced software/AI capabilities, into manufacturing, particularly in small and medium-sized enterprises, to make automation economically viable and accessible, for all sizes of manufacturers. We are not just building robots; we are creating the strategically crucial components for autonomous, intelligent agents of the future.

The Role:

Help us assemble robust, interactive simulation scenes in NVIDIA Isaac Sim. You’ll place and configure scene objects, apply rigid bodies/colliders/joints, tune physics/material properties, and set up simple interactions so scenarios run reliably for testing and demos. Programming knowledge is not required (visual scripting is welcome but optional). Core concepts and workflows map cleanly to Isaac Sim’s physics stack (PhysX) and USD-based scene components.

What You Will Do:

  • Build and maintain scenes: place assets, assign rigid bodies and colliders, verify contacts/friction behave as intended.

  • Configure constraints/joints and articulations for robots; validate overlaps, mass, damping, restitution, and solver settings.

  • Tune scene using friction, restitution, mass, damping, and solver/CCD options to achieve stable interactions.

  • Debug common physics/collision issues and keep setups performant (sensible collider choices, compound primitives when appropriate).

  • Prepare scenes and assets for cross-team testing; reproduce and fix common collision/physics issues; profile and simplify setups when needed.

  • Collaborate with simulation/robotics/AI teams to ensure scenes cover test cases and are ready for iteration.

Who You Are:

  • 2+ years hands-on with a modern real-time engine (Unity, Unreal, Godot, or Isaac Sim) building playable/testable scenes.

  • Comfortable configuring rigid bodies, colliders, and joints/constraints and knowing when to block/overlap/ignore.

  • Windows or Linux user

  • Git user: comfortable with branching, PRs, and reviewing diffs (our content and scene files live under version control).

  • Detail-oriented, organized, collaborative communicator.

  • A team player who thrives in collaborative, interdisciplinary environments.

  • An effective communicator, able to translate technical details into clear and engaging narratives.

  • Naturally curious, self-motivated, and constantly exploring new tools and approaches

Nice to Have:

  • Visual scripting/Blueprint-style experience for basic interactions.

  • Familiarity with Isaac Sim/Omniverse (USD schemas for physics, articulations).

  • Comfort with basic 3D math (transforms, vectors) relevant to collision and motion.

Why Sunrise Robotics?

  • Play a pivotal role in defining the future of intelligent robotics and manufacturing.

  • Be part of a company that is at the forefront of technological innovation, with a clear mission and vision.

  • Competitive compensation, including equity, and a flexible work environment that values innovation, learning, and excellence.
